quotes.author: Marco Rubio
quotes.body: We live in a society obsessed with public opinion. But leadership has never been about popularity.

quotes.author: Gore Vidal
quotes.body: Fifty percent of people won't vote, and fifty percent don't read newspapers. I hope it's the same fifty percent.

quotes.author: Bill Gates
quotes.body: Oh, I think there are a lot of people who would be buying and selling online today that go up there and they get the information, but then when it comes time to type in their credit card they think twice because they're not sure about how that might get out and what that might mean for them.

quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.body: Life every man holds dear but the dear man holds honor far more precious dear than life.

quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.body: Ignorance is the curse of God knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.

quotes.author: Samuel Butler
quotes.body: Lying has a kind of respect and reverence with it. We pay a person the compliment of acknowledging his superiority whenever we lie to him.

quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quotes.body: There are people who want to make men's lives more difficult for no other reason than the chance it provides them afterwards to offer their prescription for alleviating life; their Christianity, for instance.

quotes.author: Francis Bacon
quotes.body: Who ever is out of patience is out of possession of their soul.

quotes.author: Lord Byron
quotes.body: Lovers may be - and indeed generally are - enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.

quotes.author: Tim Berners Lee
quotes.body: When something is such a creative medium as the web, the limits to it are our imagination.

quotes.context: On how to become a better investor, he pointed to a stack of annual reports.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett
quotes.body: Read 500 pages like this every day.  That's how knowledge works.  It builds up, like compound interest.  All of you can do it, but I guarantee not many of you will do it.

quotes.author: H. L. Mencken
quotes.body: In this world of sin and sorrow there is always something to be thankful for as for me, I rejoice that I am not a Republican.

quotes.author: Winston Churchill
quotes.body: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.

quotes.author: Josh Billings
quotes.body: Every man has his follies - and often they are the most interesting thing he has got.

quotes.author: H. L. Mencken
quotes.body: Love is the delusion that one woman differs from another.

quotes.author: George Eliot
quotes.body: Rome - the city of visible history, where the past of a whole hemisphere seems moving in funeral procession with strange ancestral images and trophies gathered from afar.

quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce
quotes.body: Academe, n.: An ancient school where morality and philosophy were taught. Academy, n.: A modern school where football is taught.

quotes.author: Henry Ford
quotes.body: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.

quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher
quotes.body: To array a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.

quotes.author: Stephen Hawking
quotes.body: God not only plays dice, but also sometimes throws them where they cannot be seen.

quotes.author: Friedrich Schiller
quotes.body: Revenge is barren of itself: it is the dreadful food it feeds on its delight is murder, and its end is despair.

quotes.author: Franz Kafka
quotes.body: The relationship to one's fellow man is the relationship of prayer, the relationship to oneself is the relationship of striving; it is from prayer that one draws the strength for one's striving.

quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quotes.body: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.

quotes.author: Lao Tzu
quotes.body: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.body: Let every man be respected as an individual and no man idolized.
